explanation:
Source Pattern

	';' : matches the base filepath (i.e. "/path/to/file/")

	'*' : matches any string of characters

	'?' : matches any single character

	'['...']' : matches any character enclosed between the brackets
	'^' can be used to invert the selection

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Target Pattern

	'#'['u'|'l']n matches the n-th capture from the source pattern;
	'u' and 'l' (lowercase ell) can be used to convert to uppercase or lowercase, respectively.

Be aware that both patterns are case-sensitive.
examples:
Example 1
	';*[0-9].txt' -> '#1#3 - #2. list'
	This will match any 'NameNumber.txt' in the folders contained in the current directory
	and rename them to 'NumberName.txt'.

Example 2
	'sample[^a-zA-Z3].*' -> 's#1.#l2'
	This will match any file beginning with 'sample' followed by a character that is not alphabetical
	or the number '3', and the extension will be converted to lowercase.
